intro: Neillia thibetica var. caudata, commonly known as the Tibetan neillia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
